poem:
**Bridging Life**  

In the quiet pulse,  
a hatchery of hope —  
this borrowed flesh  
underneath the skin  
sings with borrowed breath.  
Pigs in tune -  
to human rhythm,  
threads of life spliced and  
spun in sinew.  
Marvel in this crossing —  
bridges built with sturdy organs,  
temporary thrum of  
what could be.
